creator: Molinari, Gustave de, 1819-1912. (author)
description: Molinari, Gustave de: 1819-1912. Born in Liège, Belgium; moved to Paris to pursue career as journalist and political economist, 1840s; strong and influential proponent of laissez-faire liberalism; became professor of political economy in Belgium to escape authoritarian France, early 1850s; returned to France, 1860s; editor of Journal des débats, 1871-1876; editor of Journal des économistes, 1881-1909. // In part I, pages 1-146, Molinari describes a journey across Canada in the autumn of 1885 by a party of delegates of Chambers of Commerce. The appendix, part II, pages [325]-332, "L'état mental et l'exécution de Louis Riel," contains considerable information on the trial of Louis Riel which was then in progress.
